about_the_game:
The world of Pick Me Up is chaotic! The settlers have yet to learn much. Become their god and help them build their settlement! Teach them your wisdom and spread technology to enrich their lives! The settlers will gladly offer resources as tribute in exchange for your divine knowledge, and with each lesson they learn, their faith in you will grow stronger.

Game Progress

· Gathering and Building: Players start by constructing gathering sites and assigning workers to collect resources. Gathered resources are transported to storage and refined into advanced materials through processing buildings. These materials are then used to craft various structures and equipment.

· Divine Intervention and Powers: Beyond issuing commands, players can directly manipulate resources or perform miracles, utilizing god-like powers to influence the settlement. This helps alleviate the slow pace typical of early gameplay stages and ensures that the player's actions continually shape the world.

· Combat and Population Growth: In the process of stabilizing and automating the settlement, combat with enemies plays a significant role. Instead of killing, enemies are stunned and then imprisoned, where they undergo reformation to eventually become part of your tribe. During battles, divine powers allow for quick strategic maneuvers by directly moving your own units, and any stunned allies can be relocated to a safe place for healing.

· Game Objective: The ultimate goal of the game is to revitalize and bring prosperity to the tribe and ensure the settlement is stably automated. Expanding the population is crucial, as players manage resources efficiently and gradually build more complex structures and equipment. The direction of the tribe’s growth varies significantly based on the player’s decisions.

Demo Play Limitations
The demo play of [Pick Me Up] lasts about 30 minutes and offers only a portion of the full game's features.

  • Research Limitations: Only basic infrastructure research, necessary for initial gameplay, is available.

  • Divine Powers: Some powers are unlocked at the start of the game, while others remain locked in the demo.

  • No Save Functionality: The demo version does not support save/load functionality.

short_description: In Pick Me Up, ME see the player as a god, and the cursor is the divine form. They pray through it for guidance. Collect resources, build, and craft equipment to support the tribe. Manage with divine plans or intervene directly by moving objects and people, showing godly will. Lead your tribe.
